title: KCCBSSA Girls Football Team Support
label: When our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best
details: In 2012, KCCBSSA established a Girls Football Team in Debre Birhan, consisting of 22 girls primarily from destitute families, guided by two male coaches. The initiative aims to empower girls by providing them with the opportunity to participate in sports, fostering both physical and intellectual development while enabling them to compete positively with their male peers.
two_detail: Since its inception, KCCBSSA has supplied the team with essential materials, including sportswear, shoes, sanitary products, and footballs. The team trains three times a week, demonstrating resilience and commitment over the years. Their dedication has led to significant achievements, including winning three trophies and receiving accolades from the North Showa Zone Youth and Sport Office. Additionally, 11 team members have been selected to represent the North Showa Zone girls' football team in the Amhara regional league, where they also secured a trophy. Through this program, KCCBSSA continues to promote gender equality and empower young girls, providing them with valuable life skills and a sense of community.
